results.title: Early metformin treatment improves pancreatic function and prevents metabolic dysfunction in early overfeeding male rats at adulthood.
results.text_hl: ABSTRACT: Given the need for studies investigating the possible long-term effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ use at crucial stages of development, and taking into account the concept of metabolic programming, the present work aimed to evaluate whether early @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ treatment might program @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ to resist the development of adult @DISEASE_Metabolic_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D008659 @@@metabolic dysfunctions@@@ caused by @<m>DISEASE_Overnutrition</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D044343 @@@overnutrition@@@ during the neonatal suckling phase.

citations.NLM: Previate C, Malta A, Miranda RA, Martins IP, Pavanello A, de Oliveira JC, Prates KV, Alves VS, Francisco FA, Moreira VM, Matiusso CCI, de Moraes AMP, Mathias PCF, Franco CCDS. Early metformin treatment improves pancreatic function and prevents metabolic dysfunction in early overfeeding male rats at adulthood. Exp Physiol. 2020 Dec;105(12):2051-2060. PMID: 33074581
citations.BibTeX: @article{33074581, title={Early metformin treatment improves pancreatic function and prevents metabolic dysfunction in early overfeeding male rats at adulthood.}, author={Previate C and Malta A and Miranda RA and Martins IP and Pavanello A and de Oliveira JC and Prates KV and Alves VS and Francisco FA and Moreira VM and Matiusso CCI and de Moraes AMP and Mathias PCF and Franco CCDS}, journal={Exp Physiol}, volume={105}, number={12}, pages={2051-2060}}
